intro: Peekeliopanax, commonly known as the giant arrowroot, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Araceae family, which includes plants like taro and calla lilies. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves that can grow up to several feet in length. Its roots are edible and are often used in cooking, similar to other members of its family. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
